title: Game-Based Mathematics Education Design: Motivation Strategies Using Gamification

context.prior_knowledge: Secondary-level mathematics fundamentals and foundational knowledge of instructional design
context.additional_context: Goal: In-service teachers acquire game-based math education design methods to improve learner engagement and motivation. Practicum-focused operation utilizing VR/simulations in a BYOD environment

learning_goals: Gamification elements (challenge tasks, reward systems, storytelling) can be applied to mathematics instruction
VR/simulation tools can be utilized to design visualizations of mathematical concepts and interactive learning activities.
Game-based assessment rubrics can be developed based on learner motivation analysis.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
